info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.healthcheck
info.description: Health check configuration for a given cluster.

post.description:
Healthcheck object defines method to determine if the given Endpoint is healthy.
Single Healthcheck object can be referred to by one or many Cluster objects.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: metadata.namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "staging"
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

get.description:
Healthcheck object defines method to determine if the given Endpoint is healthy.
Single Healthcheck object can be referred to by one or many Cluster objects.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "ns1"
The namespace in which the configuration object is present

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
name

x-example: "name"
The name of the configuration object to be fetched

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description:
The format in which the configuration object is to be fetched. This could be for example
    - in GetSpec form for the contents of object
    - in CreateRequest form to create a new similar object
    - to ReplaceRequest form to replace changeable values

Default format of returned resource
Response should be in CreateRequest format
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
Response should have other objects referring to this object
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace

namespace

x-example: "ns1"
Namespace in which the configuration object is present

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
name

x-example: "name"
Name of the configuration object

healthcheckCreateRequest.description: This is the input message of the 'Create' RPC
healthcheckCreateRequest.title: CreateRequest is used to create an instance of healthcheck

healthcheckCreateSpecType.description:
Healthcheck object defines method to determine if the given Endpoint is healthy.
Single Healthcheck object can be referred to by one or many Cluster objects.
healthcheckCreateSpecType.title: Create healthcheck

healthy_threshold.description:
Number of successful responses before declaring healthy. In other words, this is
 the number of healthy health checks required before a host is marked
 healthy. Note that during startup, only a single successful health check is
 required to mark a host healthy.

Example: ` "2"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16

interval.description:
Time interval in seconds between two healthcheck requests.

Example: ` "10"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 600

jitter_percent.description:
Add a random amount of time as a percent value to the interval between successive healthcheck requests.

Example: ` "25"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.ranges: 0,10-50

timeout.description:
Timeout in seconds to wait for successful response. In other words, it is
 the time to wait for a health check response. If the timeout is reached the
 health check attempt will be considered a failure.

Example: ` "1"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 600

unhealthy_threshold.description:
Number of failed responses before declaring unhealthy. In other words, this is
 the number of unhealthy health checks required before a host is marked
 unhealthy. Note that for http health checking if a host responds with 503
 this threshold is ignored and the host is considered unhealthy immediately.

Example: ` "5"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16

x-displayName: "DNS Query Type"
DNS Query Type

 - DNS_QTYPE_A: Query Type A

x-displayName: "Query Type A"
 - DNS_QTYPE_AAAA: Query Type AAAA

x-displayName: "Query Type AAAA"

healthcheckDNSResponseRcodeType.description:

healthcheckDeleteRequest.title: DeleteRequest is used to delete a healthcheck

fail_if_referred.description: Fail the delete operation if this object is being referred by other objects
fail_if_referred.title: fail_if_referred

name.description:
Name of the configuration object

Example: ` "name"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
Namespace in which the configuration object is present

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

healthcheckDnsHealthCheck.description:
x-displayName: "DNS Health Check"
DNS health check reports healthy if DNS query is successful and response header and answer matches the given value
healthcheckDnsHealthCheck.title: DNS Health Check

expected_response.description:
x-displayName: "Expected Response Content"
x-example: "10.0.0.1"
x-required
Specifies an IPv4 or IPv6 address in the answer section of DNS Response
expected_response.title: Expected Response Content

query_name.description:
x-displayName: "Query Name"
x-example: "www.example.com"
x-required
The query name that the monitor sends a DNS query for.
query_name.title: Query Name

reverse.description:
x-displayName: "Use Reverse mode"
x-example: false
Enable the monitor operation in reverse mode. 
When the monitor is in reverse mode, a successful receive
string match marks the monitored object down instead of up.
reverse.title: Use Reverse mode

healthcheckDnsProxyTcpHealthCheck.description:
x-displayName: "TCP Health Check"
Monitor reports healthy status if UDP connection is successful and response payload matches expected response pattern
healthcheckDnsProxyTcpHealthCheck.title: DnsProxyTcpHealthCheck

expected_response.description:
x-displayName: "Expected Response pattern"
x-example: ".*"
x-required
Specifies a regular expression pattern which will be matched against response payload
expected_response.title: expected response

send_payload.description:
x-displayName: "Send string"
x-example: ""
x-required
Text string sent in the request
send_payload.title: send string

healthcheckDnsProxyUdpHealthCheck.description:
x-displayName: "UDP Health Check"
Monitor reports healthy status if TCP connection is successful and response payload matches expected response pattern
healthcheckDnsProxyUdpHealthCheck.title: DnsProxyUdpHealthCheck

expected_response.description:
x-displayName: "Expected Response pattern"
x-example: ".*"
x-required
Specifies a regular expression pattern which will be matched against response payload
expected_response.title: expected response

send_payload.description:
x-displayName: "Send string"
x-example: ""
x-required

send_payload.title: send string

healthcheckGetResponse.title: GetResponse is the shape of a read healthcheck

deleted_referred_objects.description: The set of deleted objects that are referred by this object
deleted_referred_objects.title: deleted_referred_objects

disabled_referred_objects.description: The set of deleted objects that are referred by this object
disabled_referred_objects.title: disabled_referred_objects

referring_objects.description: The set of objects that are referring to this object in their spec
referring_objects.title: referring_objects

status.description: The status reported by different services for this configuration object
status.title: status

healthcheckGetResponseFormatCode.description:
x-displayName: "Get Response Format"
This is the various forms that can be requested to be sent in the GetResponse

 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_DEFAULT: x-displayName: "Default Format"
Default format of returned resource
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_CREATE: x-displayName: "Create request Format"
Response should be in CreateRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_REPLACE: x-displayName: "Replace request format"
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_STATUS: x-displayName: "Status format"
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_READ: x-displayName: "GetSpecType format"
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_REFERRING_OBJECTS: x-displayName: "Referring Objects"
Response should have other objects referring to this object
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_BROKEN_REFERENCES: x-displayName: "Broken Referred Objects"
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object
healthcheckGetResponseFormatCode.title: GetResponseFormatCode

healthcheckGetSpecType.description:
Healthcheck object defines method to determine if the given Endpoint is healthy.
Single Healthcheck object can be referred to by one or many Cluster objects.
healthcheckGetSpecType.title: Get healthcheck

healthy_threshold.description:
Number of successful responses before declaring healthy. In other words, this is
 the number of healthy health checks required before a host is marked
 healthy. Note that during startup, only a single successful health check is
 required to mark a host healthy.

Example: ` "2"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16

interval.description:
Time interval in seconds between two healthcheck requests.

Example: ` "10"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 600

jitter_percent.description:
Add a random amount of time as a percent value to the interval between successive healthcheck requests.

Example: ` "25"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.ranges: 0,10-50

timeout.description:
Timeout in seconds to wait for successful response. In other words, it is
 the time to wait for a health check response. If the timeout is reached the
 health check attempt will be considered a failure.

Example: ` "1"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 600

unhealthy_threshold.description:
Number of failed responses before declaring unhealthy. In other words, this is
 the number of unhealthy health checks required before a host is marked
 unhealthy. Note that for http health checking if a host responds with 503
 this threshold is ignored and the host is considered unhealthy immediately.

Example: ` "5"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16

healthcheckHttpHealthCheck.description:
Healthy if "get" method on URL "http(s)://<host>/<path>" with optional "<header>" returns success.
"host" is not used for DNS resolution. It is used as HTTP Header in the request.
healthcheckHttpHealthCheck.title: HttpHealthCheck

expected_status_codes.description:
Specifies a list of HTTP response status codes considered healthy. To treat default HTTP expected
 status code 200 as healthy, user has to configure it explicitly. This is a list of strings, each
 of which is single HTTP status code or a range with start and end values separated by "-".

Example: ` "200-250"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.http_status_range: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.max_len: 10
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.min_len: 3
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
expected_status_codes.title: Expected Status Codes

headers.description:
Specifies a list of HTTP headers that should be added to each request that is sent to the
 health checked cluster. This is a list of key-value pairs.

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.max_pairs: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.max_len: 2048
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.min_len: 1
headers.title: Headers to add in health check request

host_header.description:
Exclusive with [use_origin_server_name]
 The value of the host header.

Example: ` "one.volterra.com"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.hostport: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 262
host_header.title: host_header

path.description:
Specifies the HTTP path that will be requested during health checking.

Example: ` "/healthcheck"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.http_path: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 2048
path.title: path

request_headers_to_remove.description:
Specifies a list of HTTP headers that should be removed from each request that is sent to the
 health checked cluster. This is a list of keys of headers.

Example: ` "user-agent"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.max_len: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
request_headers_to_remove.title: Headers to be removed from health check request

use_http2.description:
If set, health checks will be made using http/2.

Example: ` false`
use_http2.title: Use HTTP2

healthcheckTcpHealthCheck.description: Healthy if TCP connection is successful and response payload matches <expected_response>
healthcheckTcpHealthCheck.title: TcpHealthCheck

expected_response.description:
raw bytes expected in the request. Describes the encoding of the payload bytes in the payload.
 Hex encoded payload.

Example: ` "00000034"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.hex: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 2048
expected_response.title: expected response

send_payload.description:
raw bytes sent in the request. Empty payloads imply a connect-only health check.
 Describes the encoding of the payload bytes in the payload.
 Hex encoded payload.

Example: ` "000000FF"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.hex: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 2048
send_payload.title: send payload

ioschemaEmpty.description: This can be used for messages where no values are needed
ioschemaEmpty.title: Empty

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schemaConditionType.description:
Conditions are used in the object status to describe the current state of the
object, e.g. Ready, Succeeded, etc.
schemaConditionType.title: ConditionType

hostname.description: Hostname of the instance of the site that sent the status
hostname.title: hostname

last_update_time.description: Last time the condition was updated
last_update_time.title: last_update_time

reason.description:
x-reason: "Insufficient memory in data plane"
 A human readable string explaining the reason for reaching this condition

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

service_name.description: Name of the service that sent the status
service_name.title: service name

status.description:
Status of the condition
 "Success" Validtion has succeded. Requested operation was successful.
 "Failed"  Validation has failed.
 "Incomplete" Validation of configuration has failed due to missing configuration.
 "Installed" Validation has passed and configuration has been installed in data path or K8s
 "Down" Configuration is operationally down. e.g. down interface
 "Disabled" Configuration is administratively disabled i.e. ObjectMetaType.Disable = true.
 "NotApplicable" Configuration is not applicable e.g. tenant service_policy_set(s) in system namespace are not applicable on REs

Example: ` "Failed"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Success\",\"Failed\",\"Incomplete\",\"Installed\",\"Down\",\"Disabled\",\"NotApplicable\"]
status.title: status

type.description:
Type of the condition
 "Validation" represents validation user given configuration object
 "Operational" represents operational status of a given configuration object

Example: ` "Operational"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Validation\",\"Operational\"]
type.title: type

schemaErrorCode.description:
Union of all possible error-codes from system

 - EOK: No error
 - EPERMS: Permissions error
 - EBADINPUT: Input is not correct
 - ENOTFOUND: Not found
 - EEXISTS: Already exists
 - EUNKNOWN: Unknown/catchall error
 - ESERIALIZE: Error in serializing/de-serializing
 - EINTERNAL: Server error
 - EPARTIAL: Partial error
schemaErrorCode.title: ErrorCode

schemaErrorType.description: Information about a error in API operation
schemaErrorType.title: ErrorType

message.description:
A human readable string of the error

Example: ` "value"`
message.title: message

schemaInitializerType.description: Initializer is information about an initializer that has not yet completed.
schemaInitializerType.title: InitializerType

name.description: name of the service that is responsible for initializing this object.
name.title: name

schemaInitializersType.description: Initializers tracks the progress of initialization of a configuration object
schemaInitializersType.title: InitializersType

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
 When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
 struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
 clients.
pending.title: pending

schemaObjectCreateMetaType.description: ObjectCreateMetaType is metadata that can be specified in Create request of an object.
schemaObjectCreateMetaType.title: ObjectCreateMetaType

annotations.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be
 set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not
 queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 64
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.max_len: 1024
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.min_len: 1
annotations.title: annotations

description.description:
Human readable description for the object

Example: ` "Virtual Host for acmecorp website"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 1200
description.title: description

disable.description:
A value of true will administratively disable the object

Example: ` "true"`
disable.title: disable

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the user. Values specified here will be used
 by selector expression

Example: ` "value"`
labels.title: labels

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
 It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
 The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.

Example: ` "acmecorp-web"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
name.title: name

namespace.description:
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
 Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

Example: ` "staging"`
namespace.title: namespace

schemaObjectGetMetaType.description: ObjectGetMetaType is metadata that can be specified in Get/Create response of an object.
schemaObjectGetMetaType.title: ObjectGetMetaType

annotations.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be
 set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not
 queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

Example: ` "value"`

  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 64
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.max_len: 1024
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.min_len: 1
annotations.title: annotations

description.description:
Human readable description for the object

Example: ` "Virtual Host for acmecorp website"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 1200
description.title: description

disable.description:
A value of true will administratively disable the object

Example: ` "true"`
disable.title: disable

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the user. Values specified here will be used
 by selector expression

Example: ` "value"`
labels.title: labels

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
 It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
 The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.

Example: ` "acmecorp-web"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
name.title: name

namespace.description:
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
 Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

Example: ` "staging"`
namespace.title: namespace

schemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
schemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then uid will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) uid.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaObjectReplaceMetaType.description: ObjectReplaceMetaType is metadata that can be specified in Replace request of an object.
schemaObjectReplaceMetaType.title: ObjectReplaceMetaType

annotations.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be
 set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not
 queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

Example: ` "value"`

Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize

 by selector expression

Example: ` "value"`

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.

schemaStatusMetaType.description: StatusMetaType is metadata that all status must have.
schemaStatusMetaType.title: StatusMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp is when the status object was created. It is used to find/tie-break
 for latest status object from same origin
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
Class of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be service's DNS FQDN.
 This will be set by the system based on client certificate information.

Example: ` "ver.re1.int.ves.io"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
ID of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be a concrete identifier for service (e.g.
 identifying the environment also). This will be set by the system based on client certificate
 information

Example: ` "ver-instance-1"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

status_id.description:
status_id is a field used by the generator to distinguish (if necessary) between two status
 objects for the same config object from the same site and same service and potentially same
 daemon(creator-id)
status_id.title: status_id

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for a StatusObject.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_id.description: Origin of this status exchanged by VTRP.
vtrp_id.title: vtrp_id

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaStatusPublishType.description:
StatusPublishType is all possible publish operations on a StatusObject

 - STATUS_DO_NOT_PUBLISH: Do Not Publish

Do not propagate this status to user. This could be because status is only informational
 - STATUS_PUBLISH: Publish

Propagate this status up to user as it might be actionable
schemaStatusPublishType.title: StatusPublishType

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

Example: ` "0"`
code.title: code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
 "Failure" status. If this value is empty there
 is no information available.

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
 One of: "Success" or "Failure".

Example: ` "value"`
status.title: status

schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.description:
SystemObjectGetMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.title: SystemObjectGetMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
 Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object

Example: ` "value"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
 field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
 directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
 from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
 finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
 Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
 future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
 For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
 by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
 the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
 remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
 exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
 resource is fully terminated.
 If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

 Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
 Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: deletion_timestamp

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
 is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
 from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
 in this list can only be removed.

Example: ` "value"`
finalizers.title: finalizers

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
 by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).

Example: ` "'ves.io/soft-deleted''true'"`
labels.title: labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: modification_timestamp

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
 for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
 be zero otherwise.

Example: ` "0"`
object_index.title: object_index

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
 presented credentials.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
 the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
 API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaViewRefType.description: ViewRefType represents a reference to a view
schemaViewRefType.title: ViewRefType

kind.description:
Kind of the view object

Example: ` "http_proxy"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

uid.description:
UID of the view object

Example: ` "f3744323-1adf-4aaa-a5dc-0707c1d1bd82"`
uid.title: uid
